clinical_study.brief_title: Preoperative Oral Immunonutrition for Patients With Pancreatic Cancer Undergoing Elective Surgery - Effect on Complications and Length of Hospital Stay
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Controlled Trial Investigating the Effect of Preoperative Oral Immunonutrition on Complications and Length of Hospital Stay After Elective Surgery for Pancreatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of preoperative immunonutrition on complications and length of hospital stay in patients with pancreatic cancer undergoing elective surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall postoperative complications after major gastrointestinal (GI) elective surgery.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 30 days after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of hospital stay after major gastrointestinal (GI) elective surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 30 days after surgery

other_outcome.measure: Weight stability, functional capability and patients´ satisfaction with the overall study course.
other_outcome.time_frame: from recruitment and within 30 days after surgery

arm_group.description: Oral Impact-arm receives the intervention the last 7 days prior to surgery
The control-arm receives no intervention but is treated according to the standard procedures

intervention.description: Oral Impact from Nestlé Health Science. An enteral nutritional supplement high in protein and with added immune-enhancing nutrients: arginine, fish oil and nucleotides. The intervention arm receives Oral Impact in an individually estimated dosage according to a protein requirement of 1.5 g/kg bodyweight/day (subtracted their habitual protein intake). Each patient receives this dosage orally the last 7 days prior to surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women referred to treatment at Surgical Gastroenterology Clinic C, Ward 2122 for pancreatic cancer
- Age > 18 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18 years
- Pregnant and lactating women
- Persons who cannot understand and/or speak Danish
- Renal dysfunction
- Milk allergy
- Participants are excluded if elective surgery is not indicated after all
